CSS Overrides for Cart Scale Components

The Cart Scale components on the Scaled Cart page and Checkout page use default Bootstrap 3 CSS styles. To modify or hide these components in a custom theme, modify the appropriate CSS in your theme's styles.css file.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) only

On the Scaled Cart page, you can modify the following components with CSS in your storefront's theme:

Search box (1)
Sort menu (2)
Pagination legend at the top of the list of cart items (3)
Pagination controls at the top of the list of cart items (4)
Pagination legend at the bottom of the list of cart items (5)
Pagination controls at the bottom of the list of cart items (6)
NOTE The CC_Theme_Minimum default theme applies default Bootstrap 3 styles to these components. The CC_Theme_Capricorn demo theme overrides the default Bootstrap 3 styles to apply customizations for the Capricorn Coffee brand identity rules.
Structure of CSS Selectors on the Scaled Cart Page

The Scaled Cart page's HTML output defines the following hierarchy of CSS selectors that you can style with a theme:

div#cartItems
    div.cc_cartscale_pagination_top
        div.cc_cartscale_page_currentPaginationPage, div.cc_cartscale_pages_totalPaginationPages, cc_cartscale_items_totalMajorCartItems
            div.cc_cartscale_searchsort
                form.cc_cartscale_search_form
                div.cc_cart_sort
            div.cc_cartscale_pagination
                span.cc_cartscale_pagination_legend
                nav.cc_cartscale_pagination_nav
                    li a.cc_cartscale_page_first
                    li a.cc_cartscale_page_previous
                    li.cc_cartscale_page_current
                        a.cc_cartscale_page_goto
                    li a.cc_cartscale_page_next
                    li a.cc_cartscale_page_last
    div.cc_cartscale_pagination_bottom
        div.cc_cartscale_page_currentPaginationPage, div.cc_cartscale_pages_totalPaginationPages, cc_cartscale_items_totalMajorCartItems
            div.cc_cartscale_pagination
                span.cc_cartscale_pagination_legend
                nav.cc_cartscale_pagination_nav
                    li a.cc_cartscale_page_first
                    li a.cc_cartscale_page_previous
                    li.cc_cartscale_page_current
                        a.cc_cartscale_page_goto
                    li a.cc_cartscale_page_next
                    li a.cc_cartscale_page_last

The following variables represent integer values, depending on the number of paginated pages and major line items in the cart:

currentPaginationPage represents the current page in the paginated results, such as 1.
totalPaginationPages represents the total number of pages in the paginated results, such as 5.
totalMajorCartItems represents the total number of the cart's major line items that match the applied search criteria, such as 22.
Examples of CSS Overrides

The following examples show how to override the default CC_Theme_Minimum theme's styles for the Scaled Cart page's components.

HIDE PAGINATION CONTROLS AT THE BOTTOM

The div.cc_cartscale_pagination_bottom selector applies to the pagination at the bottom of the list of cart items. In this example, show the pagination legend (5), but hide the corresponding controls (6, nav.cc_cartscale_pagination_nav).

.cc_cartscale_pagination_bottom nav.cc_cartscale_pagination_nav {
    display: none;
}
HIDE PAGINATION LEGEND FROM PAGE 1 OF RESULTS

The div.cc_cartscale_pagination_top selector applies to the pagination at the top of the list of cart items. In this example, for only page 1 of the paginated results (div.cc_cartscale_page_1), hide the pagination legend (3, span.cc_cartscale_pagination_legend), but show the corresponding controls (4).

.cc_cartscale_pagination_top .cc_cartscale_page_1 .cc_cartscale_pagination_legend {
    display: none;
}
HIDE THE SEARCH BOX WHEN THERE'S ONLY ONE PAGE OF RESULTS

The div.cc_cartscale_pages_1 selector applies only when the Scaled Cart page shows all items on one page. In this example, hide the search box (1, form.cc_cartscale_search_form).

.cc_cartscale_pages_1 form.cc_cartscale_search_form {
    display: none;
}
Structure of CSS Selectors on the Order Confirmation Page for an Asynchronous Order

When a buyer completes checkout using asynchronous order placement, the HTML output for the Order Confirmation section of the Checkout page includes a similar hierarchy of CSS selectors:

div#orderItems
    div.cc_orderasync_pagination_top
        div.cc_orderasync_pagination
            span.cc_orderasync_pagination_legend
            nav.cc_orderasync_pagination_nav
                li a.cc_orderasync_page_first
                li a.cc_orderasyncpage_previous
                li.cc_orderasync_page_current
                    a.cc_orderasync_page_goto
                li a.cc_orderasync_page_next
                li a.cc_orderasync_page_last
    div.cc_orderasync_pagination_bottom
        div.cc_orderasync_pagination
            span.cc_orderasync_pagination_legend
            nav.cc_orderasync_pagination_nav
                li a.cc_orderasync_page_first
                li a.cc_orderasyncpage_previous
                li.cc_orderasync_page_current
                    a.cc_orderasync_page_goto
                li a.cc_orderasync_page_next
                li a.cc_orderasync_page_last
